key_requirements: Instrument enclosures: explosion‑proof (Ex d), increased safety (Ex e) or purged/pressurised (Ex p) housings; weatherproof (NEMA 4X) for non‑hazardous areas; include sunshades and heaters if required.
Junction boxes and marshalling cabinets: stainless steel or GRP boxes with terminals; provide segregation of intrinsically safe, non‑IS and high‑voltage circuits; labelled with terminal numbers.
Construction – analyser housings shall be corrosion‑resistant and rated for the installation area; sensors must withstand process temperature and pressure.
Output signal – transmitters shall produce 4–20 mA or digital outputs (Modbus, Ethernet); provide local display for process variable【51948133245220†L4037-L4055】.
Mounting: mount sensors vertically where required; ensure proper immersion depth; avoid vibration.

pH and conductivity systems – sensors shall integrate measuring electrode, reference electrode and temperature compensation; output 4–20 mA; assembly shall allow mounting in flow‑through or submersion【51948133245220†L4109-L4148】.

Selection and Design Criteria
Measurement range and accuracy – select analyser based on detection limit and dynamic range; turbidity analyzers shall have selectable ranges (0–1, 0–3 and 0–30 NTU) and ±2 % accuracy【51948133245220†L4037-L4050】.
Sample conditioning: filtration, temperature and pressure reduction, vapourisation or condensation as required; maintain representative sample to analyser.

Training and Competence
Calibration and maintenance shall be performed by qualified technicians trained on specific instrument types.

Safety Considerations
Intrinsically safe loops must be designed as systems; ensure combined capacitance and inductance remain below safety curves.
Custody transfer systems must meet metrological regulations and security (sealing, tamper detection).
Custody metering skids: install with upstream strainers, straight runs and flow conditioners; include prover connections; insulate where required.

Safety Considerations
Vibration monitors shall trip equipment upon exceeding limits; ensure alarm circuits fail safe.
Controller performance – select processors capable of required scan times and logic complexity; design I/O loading below 60 % of capacity.

Safety Considerations
Use SIL‑rated safety PLCs for critical interlocks; design with hardware and software diversity if required.
I/O modules – choose appropriate modules (4–20 mA analog, HART‑enabled, discrete, relay); remote I/O shall be Class 1 Div 2 certified if installed in hazardous areas.
Calibration – flowmeters shall be calibrated at 20 %, 40 %, 60 %, 80 % and 100 % of range at accredited facility; calibration data submitted prior to shipment【51948133245220†L2168-L2184】.
Transmitter shall be microprocessor‑based with 4–20 mA output, LCD display, self‑diagnostics and smart communication (HART or equivalent)【51948133245220†L2099-L2160】.
Pressure switches shall be bench‑tested at setpoint and reset point; verify over‑range protection.
Pressure gauges shall be certified to ±1 % accuracy; calibrate annually or as dictated by the maintenance programme.
Transmitters shall have a calibration report at 20 %, 40 %, 60 %, 80 % and 100 % of range.
25 % of calibrated span accuracy, integral zero and span adjustments and damping; outputs shall be 4–20 mA; 316 SS wetted parts and ½‑inch NPT process connection【51948133245220†L3719-L3734】.

Sensors – gas sensors shall be housed in enclosures suitable for Class 1 Division 1, Groups C and D, and connected via digital or frequency signals to avoid RFI/EMI【51948133245220†L4273-L4311】; sensors must resist silicone and sulfur poisoning【51948133245220†L4320-L4323】; service life ≥1 year【51948133245220†L4324-L4331】.
Temperature switches shall have setpoints bench‑tested; verify deadband.
Output signal – temperature transmitters shall provide 4–20 mA DC output; include integral LCD indicator where local indication is required.
Actuators for SIS functions must meet SIL levels; incorporate redundant solenoids or voting as required.
Cv sizing – calculate required flow coefficient using process conditions and ISA 75 formulas; include minimum, normal and maximum flow; design for 70 % of valve stroke at normal conditions.
